posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
A sweet dex build!
I like Halfling here.
I like  20: Fighter(14): and taking an epic fighter bonus feat immediately.
I like Epic dodge and Crippling strike
I like trap skills and trap crafting
I like assassin 9 for Improved invisibility.
SpoilerWith a high dex and UMD; try to get a powerful mage robe, or any other item with the sequencer ability, and cast the II spell in one of the sequencer slots. It gives you an extra free casting of II every day.
I like the way you are squeezing the most out of SA/level by taking assassin 9 with 5d6 DA and rogue 17 with 9d6 SA
I like IKD in any SA/DA build.

As for skills - tanke one more look at the target values for trap skills. Decide if you want to focus on handling deadly- or epic traps.
I often end up with crafting and recovering deadly traps and setting and detecting epic traps. I then disarm epic traps with the DT spell from items or scrolls. (Though I do have skill intensive rogue builds that can recover epic traps)
Edit: I also think that Open lock: 1 (13) is a bit low for a serious rogue.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Mick

Really appreciate your comments on all the builds. A dex build is something on the 'to do list' to play. I'm very fortunate to have you comment with all your experience

I've never been great with traps. I'll try to follow your suggestions with the skills. 

The Set Trap DC of 65 for Epic Electrical Traps sounds intimidating but with Take 20, and +14 to set trap (from dex bonus and disable trap bonus) and using 'One with the Land' via UMD (+4), I'd only need 27 ranks in set trap to set these epic electrical traps. I guess I could take them out of disable trap and some out of listen (to use True Seeing with UMD)

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Mick and everyone.

Mithdradates demonstrated in one of his builds it is very possible to take 10 Great Dexterities, Epic Weapon Focus, Epic Prowess and Epic Weapon Specialisation. This was a source of inspiration to go Assassin Heavy instead. (http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 00048.html)

I made some adjustments to my own build as a result and there are some nice resulting things with my own build

Gone Assassin Heavy rather than Rogue and added a few fighter levels to be able to take 10 Great Dexterities (hooray!)

Base AB 47 (27 + 15 + 4 + 1) single handed, 45 dual wielding two Kukris!

Still has Sneak Attack 14d6

Base Dexterity 40!

Can always go ranged at any stage without any problem

I will still need to sort out the skill points which I will do in a future edit

Anyway I honestly have little practical experience here - is this stronger than previous build, or are feats such as Epic Dodge / Crippling Strike much more powerful than having the high AB and base Dex/assassin levels I've described?
